intro: Ilex pseudomacoucoua, commonly known as the Mexican holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to Central America and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are typically opposite in arrangement. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in the spring, followed by bright red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and seasonal berries.
